articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israeli tank fire hit three towns along Lebanon's southeast border with Israel on Thursday, Lebanese security sources and state media said, a day after a ceasefire barring "offensive military operations" came into force.
articles.title: Israeli tank fires at 3 south Lebanese towns, Lebanese security sources, media say

articles.author: Anastasiia Malenko, Olena Harmash, Max Hunder
articles.description: Russia unleashed its second big attack on Ukraine's energy infrastructure this month on Thursday, triggering deep power cuts across the country.
articles.title: Russia hits Ukrainian energy facilities, Kyiv sees 'despicable escalation'

articles.author: Parisa Hafezi, John Irish
articles.description: European and Iranian diplomats meet on Friday to discuss whether they can engage in serious talks in the coming weeks to defuse tensions in the region, including over Tehran's disputed nuclear programme, before Donald Trump's return to the White House.
articles.title: Iran, Europeans meet to test diplomacy with Trump term looming

articles.author: Laurie Chen, James Pomfret
articles.description: A Beijing court sentenced veteran Chinese state media journalist Dong Yuyu on Friday to seven years in prison for espionage, a family member told Reuters.
articles.title: China court sentences journalist Dong Yuyu to 7 years on spy charges, family says

articles.author: Padraic Halpin, Conor Humphries
articles.description: Ireland's two main governing parties looked on course to return to power in an election on Friday thanks to a giveaway October budget and a loss of momentum by opposition Sinn Fein, a result that would buck a global trend of voters rejecting incumbents.
articles.title: High-spending Irish coalition eyes re-election as rival Sinn Fein falters

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Mexico's Senate on Thursday passed a measure to abolish the autonomous bodies that regulate some economic sectors and ensure government transparency, a reform that has sparked outcry from the opposition and industry.
articles.title: Mexican senate passes proposal to abolish autonomous bodies

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr said on Friday that any impeachment complaint against his estranged vice president Sara Duterte, who over the weekend made threats against his life, would only tie down Congress and not help people.
articles.title: Philippines' Marcos says debate over impeachment of VP Sara Duterte a 'storm in a teacup'

articles.author: Kirsty Needham
articles.description: Australia's Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has pivoted to election mode, hoping to win back voter confidence that his government can tackle high living costs, particularly housing, after clearing the decks with a torrent of legislation.
articles.title: Australia's Albanese shifts to election mode, seeking trust on living costs

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Chinese and Russian militaries have organised and carried out the ninth joint strategic air patrol in "relevant airspace" over the Sea of Japan on Friday, Chinese state broadcaster CCTV said.
articles.title: China, Russia militaries conduct joint air patrol over Sea of Japan

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Three people have died and more than 80,000 have been evacuated from floods across several Malaysian states, the government said on Friday as officials warned the monsoon season could bring the country's worst flooding in a decade.
articles.title: Three dead, thousands displaced as Malaysia warns of worst floods in a decade
